results.prompt_sent: I'm starting work on a dark mode feature for our app. Set up everything I need to track this work: create a project for it, then create a workunit inside that project for the implementation work. The workunit should have a clear problem statement and success criteria that you derive from the feature context.

arguments.name: Dark Mode Implementation
arguments.description: Implementing dark mode feature for the app

arguments.name: Implement Dark Mode UI
arguments.problem_statement: Users experience eye strain in low-light conditions; current light mode lacks sufficient contrast and dark theme options.
arguments.success_criteria: Successfully implement system-wide dark mode with proper contrast ratios, toggle in settings, and automatic OS-level detection
arguments.description: Develop and integrate dark mode UI components across all app screens

results.task_name: Break down a feature into tasks
results.prompt_sent: I need to implement user notifications for workunit updates. Think about what steps are actually needed to build this end-to-end, then create a workunit called "Implement User Notifications" and add all the implementation tasks to it. Be thorough — this is a real feature, not a toy example.

arguments.name: Implement User Notifications
arguments.problem_statement: Users require real-time notifications for workunit status changes to ensure timely responses and collaboration.
arguments.success_criteria: Notifications are delivered via email/web in <5s, support multiple channels (email/SMS/push), include read receipts, and integrate with existing user preferences.

arguments.title: Design notification architecture
arguments.description: Create system diagram for notification delivery pipeline including triggers, channels, and storage.

arguments.title: Implement webhook integrations
arguments.description: Develop endpoints for Slack/email/push notifications using existing MCP API.

arguments.title: Build user preference manager
arguments.description: Create storage system for individual notification preferences across channels.

arguments.title: Develop delivery pipelines
arguments.description: Implement message queuing and channel-specific rendering for notifications.

arguments.title: Add read receipt tracking
arguments.description: Implement database schema and UI indicators for notification acknowledgment.

arguments.title: Create error handling layer
arguments.description: Build retry mechanisms and alerting for failed deliveries.

arguments.title: Conduct cross-browser testing
arguments.description: Verify notification delivery across all supported client environments.

arguments.title: Document implementation
arguments.description: Write API docs, user guides, and developer references for notification system.

results.prompt_sent: Search for any workunits related to authentication in our workspace. For each one you find that is still active or in draft, add an insight noting what you observed about its current state during the quarterly audit review.

We just decided to use WebSockets instead of polling for our real-time notification feature. This is important context for the team. Find the notifications workunit and save this as a critical architectural decision, explaining the tradeoffs we considered.

arguments.title: WebSockets vs Polling Architectural Choice
arguments.content: Chose WebSockets over polling for real-time notifications considering low latency, reduced server load, and improved user experience. Tradeoffs included increased complexity in connection management and scalability challenges.

results.task_name: Create a project with linked asset
results.prompt_sent: Set up a new project called "API v2" for our REST API redesign work. This project will be tracked in our GitHub repo at github.com/example/api-v2 on the main branch. Also create a knowledge asset called "API v2 Design Spec" and link it to the project — it's a document describing the new API design.

arguments.name: API v2 Design Spec
arguments.description: Document describing the new API design

results.prompt_sent: Look at the tasks in the "Implement User Notifications" workunit. Any task that mentions 'test' or 'testing' should be set to normal priority. Any task that mentions 'bug' or 'fix' should be set to high priority. Apply these rules now.

It's the end of the sprint. For the "Implement User Notifications" workunit: mark all todo tasks as done, save a progress context atom summarizing what was accomplished, and then mark the workunit itself as completed with a summary note.
